nmrglue.glue¶

Functions for reading and writing spectral data to the glue format which stores spectral data in the Hierarchical Data Format (HDF5).

glue files are HDF5 files with the spectral data stored in a dataset names ‘spectrum’ and any parameters stored in the dataset attributes. At minimum the parameter dictionary must contain a ndim key with the dimentionality of the data and a dictionry for each axis numbered (0,1,2...) with the following keys:

Key Description
car Carrier freqiency in Hz
complex True for complex data, False for magnitude
encoding type of encoding, ‘states’, ‘tppi’, ‘direct’, etc
freq True for frequency domain data, False otherwise
label Axis label, (‘13C’, etc)
obs Observation frequency in MHz
size Dimension size (R|I for direct dim, R+I for indirect)
sw Spectral width in Hz
time True for time domain data, False otherwise

This modules is imported as nmrglue.glue and can be called as such.

High-Level Functions¶

These are the functions the majority of users will use from the glue module.

nmrglue.fileio.glue.read(filename, dataset='spectrum')¶
Read a glue file
nmrglue.fileio.glue.read_lowmem(filename, dataset='spectrum')¶
Read a glue file using mimimal memory usage
nmrglue.fileio.glue.write(filename, dic, data, dataset='spectrum', overwrite=False)¶
Write dic,data pair to a HDF5 file
nmrglue.fileio.glue.make_uc(dic, data, dim=-1)¶
make a unit conversion object
nmrglue.fileio.glue.guess_udic(dic, data)¶
Guess parameters of a universal dictionary from dic,data pair
nmrglue.fileio.glue.create_dic(udic)¶
Create a glue dictionary from a universal dictionary

Low-Level Functions¶

These functions are typically not used directly by users. They are called by high level functions. Developers and user who want fine control over glue files will be interested in these functions.

nmrglue.fileio.glue.create_data(data)¶
Create glue data array (return data)
nmrglue.fileio.glue.wrap_data(data)¶
wrap h5py.highlevel.Dataset objects into a more numpy like object
nmrglue.fileio.glue.get_dic(f, dataset='spectrum')¶
Get a dictionary from dataset in a HDF5 File
nmrglue.fileio.glue.put_dic(f, dic, dataset='spectrum')¶
Put a dictionary to the dataset in a HDF5 File

Low-Level Classes¶

class nmrglue.fileio.glue.glue_2d(Dataset, order=[, 'y', 'x'])¶

glue_2d emulates numpy.ndarray objects without loading data into memory

  • slicing operations return ndarray objects.
  • can iterate over with expected results.
  • transpose and swapaxes functions create a new fid_2d object with the new axes ordering.
  • has ndim, shape, and dtype attributes.
class nmrglue.fileio.glue.glue_3d(Dataset, order=[, 'z', 'y', 'x'])¶

glue_3d emulates numpy.ndarray objects without loading data into memory

  • slicing operations return ndarray objects.
  • can iterate over with expected results.
  • transpose and swapaxes functions create a new fid_2d object with the new axes ordering.
  • has ndim, shape, and dtype attributes.
